Schulleitung Ingeborg Schröder, Malina Eberhardt, Lenze Personalmarketing, (h.l.) Jan-Frederik Theil, Fachkonferenzleitung Wirtschaft THRS, Katrin Hackl, Fachkonferenzleitung Physik THRS Michael Beckmann, Leiter Education & Training Lenze, freuen über geplante Zusammenarbeit. Theodor-Heuss-Realschule Lenze gemeinsam für Technik begeistern 16 Jul 2015 Kooperationsvereinbarung unterschrieben Eine technische Ausbildung – Weg wählen junge Menschen. Dabei bietet Voraussetzungen für erfolgreiches Berufsleben. Lenze, Spezialist für Antriebs- Automatisierungstechnik Aerzen, Hamelner Theodor-Heuss-Realschule (THRS), kooperieren, Schülerinnen Schüler für Technik technische Berufe begeistern. Dies zuletzt drohenden Fachkräftemangel entgegenzutreten. Heute unterzeichneten Partner Räumlichkeiten THRS Kooperationsvereinbarung. Es darum, Technik „begreifbar“ machen, Schule Beruf näher bringen Technik-Unterricht praxisnaher gestalten. Lenze stellt dafür „Lego-Mindstorm“-Roboterbausätze Verfügung, bietet Praktikumsplätze, Betriebserkundungen Bewerbungstrainings an. Kurz Schulabschluss für Jugendliche unklar mal landen werden. „Welche Ausbildung mache ich? Soll Abitur studieren?“ Das Fragen, junge Menschen stellen. Um Schülerinnen Schüler für technische Ausbildungsberufe Studiengänge begeistern, Lenze THRS enger zusammenarbeiten. Um Kompetenzen Schülerinnen Schüler Naturwissenschaften Informatik stärken, stellt Lenze THRS außerdem „Lego-Mindstorm“-Roboterbausätze für Physikunterricht Verfügung. So bekommen Jugendlichen Möglichkeit, Spaß greifbaren Ergebnissen Welt Technik erkunden. Bei Einführung Technik Roboter arbeiten Lenze-Azubis Katrin Hackl, Fachkonferenzleitung Physik THRS Leiterin Wahlpflichtkurses Physik, Hand Hand zusammen. „Schon Vergangenheit Roboterbausätzen gearbeitet. Die stets überfüllten Kurse signalisieren uns, Angebot Interesse Schülerinnen Schülern geweckt haben“, Hackl. „Die praktische Arbeit Technik jungen Leuten helfen, beruflich orientieren.“ „Bei Ort Praktikum Rahmen Betriebserkundung können Jugendlichen zudem hautnah erleben, Ausbildung Lenze gehört vielfältig technischen Berufe sind“, Michael Beckmann, Leitung Education & Training Lenze. „Nachwuchsförderung Lenze Fahnen geschrieben. Gemeinsam Schulen Beitrag leisten, Fachkräftemangel entgegenzuwirken“, Beckmann. „Davon profitiert gesamte Region.“ Dateien: Kooperation Lenze Theodor Heuss Realschule PI Kooperation Lenze THRS Weitere Informationen RSS Feed Über Lenze Lenze Deutschland Vertrieb Lenze Performance Partner Presse Presseinformationen 2014 2013 Auszeichnungen Mediathek Ansprechpartner Messe- Eventkalender Training Karriere Newsletter EG-Dual-Use-Verordnung Materialteuerungszuschlag Unternehmensgruppe 5 Schritte für Ihren Freiraum Globale Präsenz Umwelt & Energieeffizienz Unsere Verantwortung Automation Systems Drive Solutions Produkte Aftersales Branchenexpertisen Elektromobilität Lenze Deutschland Standort ändern Impressum Datenschutzhinweis Nutzungsbedingungen Sitemap

Hans-Lenze-Stiftung Aerzen 25 24 Jul 2015 Stiftung ermöglichte dato 50 jungen Menschen weiterführendes Studium Im Juli 2015 feiert Hans-Lenze-Stiftung Aerzen 25-jähriges Bestehen. Die Stiftung fördert engagierte begabte junge Menschen, weiterqualifizieren möchten, finanziellen Mittel dafür fehlen. 50 Stipendiaten Förderung In- Ausland Aufbaustudium absolvieren, promovieren, habilitieren Forschungsprojekten teilnehmen. Julia Opel, Vorsitzende Stiftung, erklärt: „Mit unserem Angebot möchten Einzelnen verdiente Unterstützung geben, aktiv Lebensweg gestalten. Zum überzeugt, Investition Ausbildung wichtige Investition Zukunft. Wir sehen Pflicht, Nachwuchs fördern – über betriebliche Aus- Weiterbildung Lenze hinaus.“ Elisabeth Belling gründete Stiftung 1990 anlässlich 100. Geburtstags Vaters Hans Lenze, Gründer Familienunternehmens Lenze, international agierender Spezialist für Antriebs- Automatisierungstechnik. Tahnee Harre 50. Stipendiatin Hans-Lenze-Stiftung Aerzen. Sie beginnt September 2015 Masterstudium „Management of People“ University of Southern Denmark Odense, Dänemark. Zu Erfahrung Hans-Lenze-Stiftung Aerzen Betriebswirtin begeistert: „Ich finde einzigartig, individuell Stiftung Menschen unterstützt.“ Die Fachrichtung für Auswahl Stipendiaten untergeordneter Bedeutung. Vielmehr zählt besonderer Einsatz, sozial engagiert Kulturen gegenüber aufgeschlossen für stark machen. Ausschlaggebend für Zuschlag zudem, Bewerber Weiterqualifizierung Studium Mitteln finanzieren können. In 25 Jahren Bestehens blieb Stiftung stets Familienhand, Generation. Den Stiftungsvorsitz Stiftungsgründerin Elisabeth Belling 1997 Tochter Babette Herbert weiter. Seit 2002 Urenkelin Hans Lenze, Julia Opel, Vorsitz inne. „Wir kennen mittlerweile große Bedeutung internationaler Erfahrung für persönliche berufliche Entwicklung“, Julia Opel. „Daher unterstützen Stipendiaten Auslandsstudium, interkulturelles Verständnis fördern. Bis Stipendiaten Aufenthalte USA, Japan, Australien, England, Schottland, China Dänemark ermöglicht.“ Um sozialen Auftrag nachzukommen, unterstützt Hans-Lenze-Stiftung Aerzen Stipendiaten bedarfsgerechte Finanzmittel, während Stipendium über persönliche Kontakte Erfahrungsaustausch. „Ich freue vielfältigen Erfahrungen, Austausch dankbar für finanzielle Sorgenfreiheit, Hans-Lenze-Stiftung Aerzen ermöglicht. So Studium konzentrieren“, Tahnee Harre. Übrigens: Für Jahr 2016 Hans-Lenze-Stiftung Aerzen möglichen Stipendien vergeben. Für Rückfragen steht Petra Stein über petra.stein@lenze.com Verfügung. August 2015 starteten tausende junge Leute Lebensphase Verantwortung. Bei Lenze beginnen Jahr 23 junge Frauen Männer Ausbildung duales Studium. Erster Schritt Berufsleben Lenze: Alle verbringen gemeinsam Orientierungstage Groß Berkel Extertal bekommen somit wichtigen Überblick über Ausbildung Unternehmen. Gefördert Austausch Auszubildenden Studenten verschiedenen Fachrichtungen. Der Nachwuchs Lenze hohen Stellenwert, langfristig innovativ arbeiten können Fachkräftemangel entgegenzuwirken. Auch Grund lässt Vorstandsvorsitzende Christian Wendler nehmen, Ausbildungsjahrgang kommenden Tagen persönlich begrüßen. Für Lenze Technologieunternehmen wesentliche Aufgabe, Nachwuchs entwickeln fördern. Lenze Jahren „Land Bewegung“ ausgerufen, Schülerinnen Schüler junge Talente für Technik Allgemeinen Unternehmen Speziellen begeistern. Heute starteten 23 Auszubildende Studenten Berufslaufbahn sogenannten Orientierungstagen. Nach Begrüßung „Lenzianer“ Ralf Klemme, Head of Human Resources, direkt Workshops los. Abteilungsübergreifend dient vielfältige Programm Orientierung Arbeitswelt. Außerdem erhalten jungen Leute zahlreiche Schulungen Einführungen grundlegende Themen Rechte Pflichten Sicherheitsbestimmungen. Doch Kennenlernen, Spaß Teambuilding kurz: Betriebsrallys Standorten Groß Berkel Extertal „Azubis“ „Studis“ helfen, zurechtzufinden. Die Aufgabe, Gruppe schöne schnelle Seifenkiste bauen, stärkt außerdem Teamarbeit. Die 16 24 Jahre jungen Auszubildenden Studenten verteilen Jahr verschiedene Ausbildungs- Studiengänge. Nach Ausbildung können jungen Leute Elektroniker, Mechatroniker (B.Sc.), Produktionstechniker (B.Eng.) Industriekaufmann nennen. Auch Lenze-Töchter encoway bhn begrüßen Jahr Auszubildende duale Studenten Bereichen Anwendungsentwicklung Büromanagement bzw. Wirtschaftsinformatik. If you are looking to eject goods smoothly and at exactly the right location, "belt tray sorters" can take over the sorting and distributing duties. Sorters employ two different types of ejection here: soft ejection via tilting movement of the tray or ejection through sideways movement of the goods. We offer solutions for both types, for example with our Inverter Drives 8400 HighLine together with the MCS synchronous servo motors . Green, even black on white: climate protection with environmental certification. In the same way, which we efficiently move the machines of our customers, we ensure our own backyard that our products are manufactured with consideration of the environment protection. Sustainability and efficiency are matter of course and integral component of our corporate philosophy. Beginning with our internal measures and our product portfolio we achieve efficient effects to crucially reduce environmentally relevant emissions. In turn, our environmental management system has received the ISO 14001 certification. Improved energy usage goes hand hand with reduction environmental pollution. We show you how intelligent drive and automation technology can make more efficient use of energy, and we undertake to act sustainably and responsibly for future generations. Ecologically useful, ecologically valuable. Lenze BlueGreen Solutions. Almost half of the electrical energy that is produced today is consumed by industrial applications. Responsible for large portion of the total amount of consumed energy are electrical drive systems. And exactly for this reason, the highest potential for increase energy efficiency can be found here. With sustainable effects: better utilisation includes at the same time less pollution of the environment, relief for the resources and reduction of energy costs - with steady and consistent productivity. Saving energy is one of the greatest challenges we face today and which we happily face. We show you how more efficient use can be made of energy with intelligent drive and automation technology - with our Lenze BlueGreen Solutions. Material price surcharge - Lenze Hrvatskoj. As easy as that. Hrvatski Hrvatski English Select Country Hrvatska (Croatia) Österreich (Austria) Argentina België (Belgium) Canada България (Bulgaria) Brasil (Brazil) Česká republika (Czech Republic) Chile Danmark (Denmark) France Suomi (Finland) Deutschland (Germany) Magyarország (Hungary) India Italia (Italy) 한국 (Korea) Latvijā (Latvia) Lietuvoje (Lithuania) México (Mexico) Nederland (Netherlands) Norge (Norway) Polska (Poland) Россия (Russia) Philippines Singapore Slovensko (Slovakia) Slovenija (Slovenia) South Africa España (Spain) Sverige (Sweden) 台灣 (Taiwan) Türkiye (Turkey) United Kingdom United States Tisak Press releases Awards Media gallery Termini Trade fair and events calendar Training Training offers Online Training Contact Karijera Current vacancies Contact Preuzimanje Sales literature Technical documentation Software Downloads Application Knowledge Base CAD data EPLAN P8 macros Certificates and declarations Lenze apps E-katalog Find drive solutions Drive dimensioning Find and configure products Product changeover to g500 geared motors Kontakt Lenze Hrvatskoj Lenze worldwide Contact form Go Home O Lenzeu Lenze Hrvatskoj Material price surcharge Material price surcharge Background information on the material price surcharge for synchronous servo motors Magnets containing the raw materials Neodymium and Dysprosium are used for the synchronous servo motors. Due to general shortage on the global market, the prices of these rare raw materials have increased dramatically since the end of 2010. This price trend has therefore led to severe increase the cost of magnets and thereby synchronous servo motors. To cater to this pronounced increase costs, material price surcharge (MPS) has been introduced. This MPS does not actually contain any extra charges, but rather simply reflects the additional costs of the magnets caused purely by the procurement situation. It is not currently possible to predict the global price development. However, we must assume that these resources are likely to become even rarer and that the prices therefore continue to increase. Calculating the material price surcharge The MPS is based on quotes provided by Asian Metal www.asianmetal.com for the raw materials of Neodymium and Dysprosium. The MPS is calculated based on the weight of the rare elements contained the magnets and the difference between the current raw material price and the March 2011 base price. The key factor for the material price surcharge to be paid is the rate we pay on the day of invoicing, assuming the respective invoice is drafted no later than 5 days after delivery. Otherwise, the value valid on the day of delivery is used. Formula for calculating the MPS: Level of MPS per motor Weight of Neodymium per motor kg (Neodymium price quoted on the cut-off day - base value of Neodymium as at March 2011) + weight of Dysprosium per motor kg (Dysprosium price quoted on the cut-off day - base value of Dysprosium as at March 2011) (The key quotes are those provided by Asian Metal. The "cut-off day" is the date defined above for calculation of the MPS.) EC dual-use regulation - Lenze Hrvatskoj. As easy as that. Hrvatski Hrvatski English Select Country Hrvatska (Croatia) Österreich (Austria) België (Belgium) България (Bulgaria) Česká republika (Czech Republic) Danmark (Denmark) France Suomi (Finland) Deutschland (Germany) Magyarország (Hungary) Italia (Italy) Latvijā (Latvia) Lietuvoje (Lithuania) Nederland (Netherlands) Polska (Poland) Slovensko (Slovakia) Slovenija (Slovenia) España (Spain) Sverige (Sweden) United Kingdom Tisak Press releases Awards Media gallery Termini Trade fair and events calendar Training Training offers Online Training Contact Karijera Current vacancies Contact Preuzimanje Sales literature Technical documentation Software Downloads Application Knowledge Base CAD data EPLAN P8 macros Certificates and declarations Lenze apps E-katalog Find drive solutions Drive dimensioning Find and configure products Product changeover to g500 geared motors Kontakt Lenze Hrvatskoj Lenze worldwide Contact form Go Home O Lenzeu Lenze Hrvatskoj EC dual-use regulation EC dual-use regulation What is the EC dual-use regulation? The EC dual-use regulation (Regulation (EC) No. 428/2009) is instrument applied by the European Community to control the export of goods, including data processing programs and technologies, that can be used for dual purposes. The Regulation defines the term "dual use" items as referring to goods that can be used for both civilian and military purposes. Annex I of the EC Dual Use Regulation contains list of the goods that it is not permissible to export to another country unless prior authorisation to do has been obtained. What changes are there and what does this mean for the export of frequency converters? The technical characteristics relevant to the export of frequency converters (Lenze calls them inverters) are indicated No. 3A225 of Annex I of the above-named regulation. As consequence of the changes the technical characteristics specified there, the export controls for inverters have been expanded. This means that export authorisation now has to be obtained for inverters that could previously be exported without authorisation. How do I know whether the export of inverter requires prior authorisation? If the export of Lenze inverter requires prior authorisation, Lenze indicates this on all relevant business papers and documents (offers, order papers, delivery papers etc.) by noting the following: "Product requiring export authorisation when shipping to countries outside the EC – Export List No. 3A225 (EC Dual Use Regulation)" Is the availability of Lenze inverters restricted due to the changes the regulation? No. Where Lenze exports affected products into countries outside the EC, we perform all the necessary procedures and arrange for the required export authorisation, thus ensuring availability of the products. Therefore there is no change the availability of inverters. Does export authorisation have to be obtained for inverters that are built into another product/machine? No, for the vast majority of applications this is not the case. The question if the inverter can be considered the principal element of the application plays the key role this context. In judging whether the inverter is to be considered the principal element, it is necessary to weigh the factors of quantity, value and technological know-how involved and other special circumstances which might establish the inverter as the principal element of the machine it is built into. In any case, every exporter is obliged to independently check whether export authorisation is required. What customs tariff number do Lenze inverters have? The customs tariff number for Lenze inverters is 85044090 What do I have to do if I want to export Lenze inverter to another country? Delivery within the European Union: For shipments within the EC, no export authorization is required. The requirement to obtain export authorisation for the product the case of export outside the EC must however be indicated on all relevant business papers. Depending on the final destination of the product to be exported, general export authorisations (e.g. EU 001) can be used some cases. The exact rules depend on the EU country from which you want to export the inverter. This is because implementation of the EC dual-use regulation varies from country to country. Please contact the responsible authorities to obtain the relevant information. Can we as customer use Lenze's export authorisation for exports to third countries? No, the export authorisation is not transferrable. For which Lenze inverters is authorisation required? Product family Export authorisation required? Inverter > Inverter - decentralised Inverter Drives 8400 protec Yes* Inverter Drives 8400 motec No Inverter Drives SMV IP65 No Inverter > Inverter - control cabinet Servo Drives 9400 HighLine Yes Inverter Drives 8400 TopLine Yes* i700 Yes Inverter Drives 8400 HighLine Yes* Inverter Drives 8400 StateLine Yes* Inverter Drives SMV IP31 No Inverter Drives 8400 BaseLine No Motors Lenze Smart Motor No Previous products > Inverter Servo Drives ECS Yes 9300 servo inverters Yes 9300 vector inverters Yes 8200 vector inverters Yes 8200 motec inverters Yes * Variants that do not require export authorisation are available on request If your product is not on the list, please get touch with your responsible contact person at Lenze Any further questions? If you have any further questions on this topic, your responsible contact person at Lenze be happy to help you. Još 1980. započelo se razvojem tržišta. Partner za korisnike Hrvatskoj BiH bila austrijska podružnica Lenze Antriebstechnik. Godine 2000. osnovano predstavništvo za informacije usluge, sjedištem Zagrebu. Zbog brzog rasta poslova predstavništvo 2007. preraslo 100%-tnu podružnicu grupe Lenze Austria. Podružnica Lenze Mehatronika - pogonska tehnika d.o.o. ima sjedište Zagrebu. Ona zadužena za potrebe naših kupaca Hrvatskoj BiH. Od jednostavnih tehničkih zadataka do složenih pogonskih rješenja. Naš tim kompetentnih komercijalista uključujući terenske, inženjera primijenjene tehnologije specijaliziranih servisnih tehničara pruža pouzdane usluge po potrebi 24 sata dnevno. Kompletni pogonski sustavi isporučuju se iz najveće tvornice za proizvodnju montažu Austriji, sjedištem Astenu. There are two basic operating principles here: Pistons and gear pumps or axial-flow fans work according to the principle of displacement, while centrifugal pumps and radial-flow fans operate with centrifugal force. Our services, products and systems are freely scalable on the basis of well-designed modular system. Hrvatski Hrvatski English Select Country Hrvatska (Croatia) Österreich (Austria) Argentina België (Belgium) Canada България (Bulgaria) Brasil (Brazil) 中国 (China) Česká republika (Czech Republic) Chile Danmark (Denmark) France Suomi (Finland) Deutschland (Germany) Magyarország (Hungary) India Italia (Italy) 한국 (Korea) Latvijā (Latvia) Lietuvoje (Lithuania) México (Mexico) Nederland (Netherlands) Norge (Norway) Polska (Poland) Россия (Russia) Philippines Singapore Slovensko (Slovakia) Slovenija (Slovenia) South Africa España (Spain) Schweiz (Switzerland) Sverige (Sweden) 台灣 (Taiwan) Türkiye (Turkey) United Kingdom United States Tisak Press releases Awards Media gallery Termini Trade fair and events calendar Training Training offers Online Training Contact Karijera Current vacancies Contact Preuzimanje Sales literature Technical documentation Software Downloads Application Knowledge Base CAD data EPLAN P8 macros Certificates and declarations Lenze apps E-katalog Find drive solutions Drive dimensioning Find and configure products Product changeover to g500 geared motors Kontakt Lenze Hrvatskoj Lenze worldwide Contact form Go Home O Lenzeu Lenze Hrvatskoj News Press releases Detail Compact and simple: the new MCM synchronous servo motors Compact and simple: the new MCM synchronous servo motors 13 Apr 2015 Lenze adds servo motors with intermediate-level dynamic performance to its portfolio Lenze has long been leading supplier of servo systems and technology. With its new MCM synchronous servo motors, the specialist drives and automation systems is now extending its portfolio to include motors with intermediate-level dynamic performance. The MCM series is very compact, easy to control and characterised by its optimally smooth running features. The new synchronous servo motors are therefore eminently suitable for the most varied of positioning tasks. At the Hannover Fair (Stand H20, Hall 14, 13 to 17 April), Lenze be presenting the new motors to wide public for the very first time. Robotics, packaging equipment and handling systems are typical areas of use for the MCM motors, which are easy to control thanks to their especially favourable torque/inertial mass ratio. Thanks to their optimally smooth running characteristics, they ensure precise results and are particularly suitable for applications where smooth running is very important. The motors are tailored for the performance of simple positioning tasks requiring intermediate-level dynamic performance. For highly dynamic high-end applications with maximum requirements respect of dynamics and precision, Lenze supplies the tried-and-tested MCS motors. The housing of the new series has smooth, easy to clean surfaces with the IP65 protection class. This qualifies the compact motors for use the food industry too. The motors are equipped with robust resolver feedback system as standard feature, but can be optionally supplied with multiturn sin-cos encoders for high precision. SpeedTec connections with rotary connector boxes enable speedy installation and replacement the event of service. The new motor series initially comes three sizes, namely 06, 09 and 12, with power ratings of 0.2 to 2.5 kW. In conjunction with the i700, 9400 and 8400 TopLine servo inverters, economically efficient and powerful drive solutions are therefore possible the torque range from 0.6 to 26.4 Nm. Power regeneration can be easy - Lenze Hrvatskoj. As easy as that. Hrvatski Hrvatski English Select Country Hrvatska (Croatia) Österreich (Austria) Argentina België (Belgium) Canada България (Bulgaria) Brasil (Brazil) 中国 (China) Česká republika (Czech Republic) Chile Danmark (Denmark) France Suomi (Finland) Deutschland (Germany) Magyarország (Hungary) India Italia (Italy) 한국 (Korea) Latvijā (Latvia) Lietuvoje (Lithuania) México (Mexico) Nederland (Netherlands) Norge (Norway) Polska (Poland) Россия (Russia) Philippines Singapore Slovensko (Slovakia) Slovenija (Slovenia) South Africa España (Spain) Schweiz (Switzerland) Sverige (Sweden) 台灣 (Taiwan) Türkiye (Turkey) United Kingdom United States Tisak Press releases Awards Media gallery Termini Trade fair and events calendar Training Training offers Online Training Contact Karijera Current vacancies Contact Preuzimanje Sales literature Technical documentation Software Downloads Application Knowledge Base CAD data EPLAN P8 macros Certificates and declarations Lenze apps E-katalog Find drive solutions Drive dimensioning Find and configure products Product changeover to g500 geared motors Kontakt Lenze Hrvatskoj Lenze worldwide Contact form Go Home O Lenzeu Lenze Hrvatskoj News Press releases Detail Power regeneration can be easy Power regeneration can be easy 13 Apr 2015 Lenze presents prototype of new-style energy recovery system / University acts as development partner At the Hannover Industrial Fair Lenze is presenting the prototype of new kind of solution for feeding energy back into mains and is demonstrating its strength as innovator once again. The concept's main features are its easy handling, compact design, and great efficiency. Because the infeed path and the feedback path have been separated, they can be separately dimensioned, which makes it possible to dimension them precisely to provide whatever the system requires. The new regenerative power unit deploys brand-new technology: at its core are fast-switching semiconductors made of silicon carbide (SiC), enabling the unit to achieve high level of efficiency while being extremely compact and light. Thanks to their high efficiency, the units pay for themselves very short time. They can be scaled from 2 kW to 48 kW, and even as retrofit they can be very easily integrated into existing installations. This opens up completely new perspectives for the machine-building industry, even applications where energy recovery has far not been economically feasible. Lenze has developed the new unit two research projects, working collaboration with the University of Ostwestfalen-Lippe and backed by funding from the German Federal Ministry of Education and Research. With this solution, Lenze is aiming for the effective regeneration of the exact amount of brake energy that remains multi-axis applications, such as storage and retrieval units automated warehouses, after mechanical optimisation, needs-oriented drive dimensioning, and energy exchange DC bus connection. The new unit can be used horizontally deployed single axes, where the traditional regenerative power units far have never been economical enough because of the small amount of brake energy generated by those applications. This field of application includes drives horizontal materials-handling technology, for example. At the heart of the new regenerative power units there are fast-switching semiconductors made of silicon carbide (SiC). This high-tech substance enables the unit's innovative components to achieve high switching frequencies, the devices are only half as big and heavy as the current comparable technology. And there is more good news for the machine-operating companies: comparison with block-commutation solutions, the new devices pay for themselves half the time: the goal is to reach full amortisation less than two years, depending on the amount of energy used by the machine. Lenze has designed the new power feedback system way that enables the device to be deployed without having to set parameters and without any signal interfaces. The installation takes places on the DC bus of the inverter or, if that is not available, on the brake chopper connection. This makes it easy even to retrofit the new technology to existing systems. The device's power range can be very easily scaled by means of parallel connection. Hrvatski Hrvatski English Select Country Hrvatska (Croatia) Österreich (Austria) Argentina België (Belgium) Canada България (Bulgaria) Brasil (Brazil) 中国 (China) Česká republika (Czech Republic) Chile Danmark (Denmark) France Suomi (Finland) Deutschland (Germany) Magyarország (Hungary) India Italia (Italy) 한국 (Korea) Latvijā (Latvia) Lietuvoje (Lithuania) México (Mexico) Nederland (Netherlands) Norge (Norway) Polska (Poland) Россия (Russia) Philippines Singapore Slovensko (Slovakia) Slovenija (Slovenia) South Africa España (Spain) Schweiz (Switzerland) Sverige (Sweden) 台灣 (Taiwan) Türkiye (Turkey) United Kingdom United States Tisak Press releases Awards Media gallery Termini Trade fair and events calendar Training Training offers Online Training Contact Karijera Current vacancies Contact Preuzimanje Sales literature Technical documentation Software Downloads Application Knowledge Base CAD data EPLAN P8 macros Certificates and declarations Lenze apps E-katalog Find drive solutions Drive dimensioning Find and configure products Product changeover to g500 geared motors Kontakt Lenze Hrvatskoj Lenze worldwide Contact form Go Home O Lenzeu Lenze Hrvatskoj News Press releases Detail Lower Saxony’s Premier visits Lenze Lower Saxony’s Premier visits Lenze 16 Apr 2015 At the HMI, Stephan Weil finds out about solutions for easy engineering the machine-building industry The Prime Minister of Lower Saxony, Stephan Weil, paid visit to the Lenze stand at the famous industrial fair Hannover, the HMI, learning about the company's range of products and services. The specialist for drive and automation technology, with major sites Aerzen/Gross Berkel and Extertal/Bösingfeld, presenting solutions the context of Industry 4.0. This initiative places special importance on energy efficiency and the networking of machines, Lenze is offering intelligent drive solutions and software modules that can be used, for example, automobile production, packaging machines or conveyor systems. The Lenze board of directors, consisting of Christian Wendler, Frank Maier and Dr. Yorck Schmidt, welcomed the Prime Minister and introduced Lenze as technology partner that provides its customers all over the world with support creating machines quickly and easily - from the initial idea right the way through to safe and reliable machine operation. At the fair, Lenze exhibited modular and standardised software along with intelligent drive packages that promise to carry out machine tasks as easily and reliably as possible while at the same time significantly reducing the time and effort required for engineering work. Lenze demonstrated at its stand that this pledge to customers is pledge with substance: visitors were able to get to grips with three exhibits, commissioning roller conveyor 3 minutes, belt conveyor 5 minutes or gantry robot 7 minutes. Benefit from yet another link Lenze‘s engineering tool chain! The new EASY Explorer selection tool can be used the very early planning phase of drive solution to provide fast overview of suitable Lenze products. No extensive product knowledge is needed. In fact, all you need to do is enter some basic data and the EASY Explorer then calculate your application's requirements and suggest suitable solutions. The software involves just 3 steps and is both fast and easy to use: Select the application type: "Travel/Conveying", "Lifting" or "Rotary" Enter just few parameters The EASY Explorer displays the process requirements and various solution alternatives. This provides you with initial drive recommendations, even making CAD and Eplan macros available. If you would then like more details, the solution can be transferred to the Drive Solution Catalogue . And the Drive Solution Designer is even more precise. Lenze Smart Motor app This app allows the parameterization of the Lenze Smart Motor with NFC-enabled smartphone or tablet. The Lenze Smart Motor reduces the number of different drive versions by up to 70%. Contactor and starter do not feature, fixed speeds can be set at and there are numerous integrated functions for materials handling applications. Welcome to Lenze. Motion is what distinguishes us as innovative company. It is the central element of our day-to-day work, what we think and what we do - both on the business side and personally. We not only ensure that our customers' machines keep going, we try to provide conditions that enhance the mental and physical agility of our employees. What's more, we pursue committed social agenda, helping to keep things moving the region where we are active. This is our Land of Motion. When you work for us, you find many ways of developing not only your career but yourself as person. As intern, student, specialist, team leader, project manager or member of the company's management team, you be working dynamic environment that allows you to choose the direction that best suits you. Go with the flow. Start-up trainings Design engineer Project planner Application engineer Programmer The ideal choice right from the start: our one-day start-up training courses give you quick and very practical introduction to what our products, solutions and systems can do for you. Knowing this make it easy for you to make the best choices when you implement your machine concept. Commissioning and application training Design engineer Project planner Application engineer Programmer Commissioning engineer Getting your machine operating quickly: technical expertise is essential for successfully implementing your ideas. In our commissioning and application training for systems you get to know our products and software more detail – for seamless application and smooth operation. Service training Maintenance engineer Commissioning engineer Safeguarding operation the long term: our service training equip you with the practical knowledge you need for reliable machine diagnostics and rapid troubleshooting. And for the worst-case scenario, you learn how to replace faulty elements quickly and make your machine ready for operation once again. Lenze FAST Application Software Up to 80% of software engineering requirements are covered by Lenze's FAST (Feasibly Applicable Software Toolbox) . Industry sector expertise Solutions for the Automotive Industry Car manufacturers must be able to rely on dependable materials handling technology, exact positioning systems, quick handling systems and different robot applications - from the press shop and body shop right through final assembly. Solutions for the consumer goods industry Lenze offers the most modern automation and motion technology for the consumer goods industry – based on the 3 standards of cost awareness, maximum quality and flexibility. Solutions for airports Baggage handling at the airport places stringent demands on conveyor systems. Solutions for postal and parcel If your goal is to send parcels and letters quickly and efficiently, what you need is powerful parcel centre . Solutions for logistics centres In our many years of experience materials handling technology, working on countless projects and collaborating closely with our customers, not to mention our talks with those the know, we are very familiar with the latest developments the field of automated warehousing . In future, you need to successfully handle more extensive tasks ever shorter times frames. So it's good to know that you have partner at your side who can make many of these tasks easy. This is our top priority and the focus of our action is: you! With our motivated and committed approach, we work together with you to create the best possible solution and set your ideas motion - regardless of whether you are looking to optimise existing machine or develop new one. As global specialist Motion Centric Automation, we offer you products, drive solutions, complete automation systems, engineering services and tools from single source. We are one of the few providers the market who are alongside you for the entire development process of your machine – from initial ideas to aftersales, from the control system all the way to the drive shaft. Learn about our wide range of skills and discover everything you need to know about one of the leading drive and automation specialists the field of machine engineering. As easy as that. The functions of our finely scaled products are assigned to the three lines Base-Line, State-Line or High-Line. But what does this mean for you? It allows you to quickly recognise which products represent the best solution for your own specific requirements. Powerful products with major impact: Easy handling High quality and durability Reliable technologies tune with the latest developments Lenze products undergo the most stringent testing our own laboratory. This allows us to ensure that you receive consistently high quality and long service life. In addition to this, five logistics centres ensure that the Lenze products you select are available for quick delivery anywhere across the globe. As easy as that. Baggage handling at the airport places stringent demands on conveyor systems. Often piece of baggage needs to be transported along conveyor belts for several kilometres until it finally reaches its destination. A bar code system usually allows the baggage to be stored temporarily until it can be sorted and transported to its removal station at exactly the right time. Ideal for large airports: baggage handling systems with containers What is important here is the ability to differentiate between active and passive conveyor units: active units have their own control system and motor and they travel along their path fully automatically. Passive conveyor unit are driven along belts and/or rolls and require more complex path guidance. Transport speeds of up to 14 m/s can be reached. Perfect for small airports: systems without containers Especially economical are conveyor systems without containers. However, the maximum throughput is much smaller. These only reach speeds of 2 to 3 m/s. They are usually transported along belt conveyors, are sorted by so-called pushers or cross-belt sorters and tilt-tray sorters. Check-in: perfect timing. Shuttle systems offer improved flexibility many high bay warehouses and offer very fast and precise access to products, particularly during peak periods. The shuttle moves within shelf aisles similarly to storage and retrieval unit here, but on various levels. As such, these autonomous vehicles offer easy scalability with regard to the order picking performance and capacity of the warehouse system. Shuttle systems are today offered with or without integrated lifting device and are suitable for containers, boxes, trays and, special forms, for pallets. Our solutions here are individual and efficient, as well as being precisely tailored to your specific requirements. Possible combinations for example include deployments with Inverter Drives 8400 TopLine together with the Controller 3200 C and the I/O system 1000 . Our geared motors, connection with inverter-optimised MF three-phase AC motors or highly dynamic MCA asynchronous servo motors and MCS synchronous servo motors , round off our offer. A monorail overhead conveyor with intelligent motor control is the ideal solution for conveyor system that is designed to automatically direct itself to predefined target positions. This kind of conveyor system operates using rails that are mounted to ceilings or to supports and gives you the ability to transport your products overhead. Inverters are designed specifically for this purpose that are attached to the overhead conveyor directly with take-up device. This is why they must be vibration-resistant and designed to meet IP65 protection requirements. The perfect choice here: Inverter Drives 8400 protec EMS with the compact GKK monorail gearbox. From cup production, through filling, all the way up to sealing: everything is integrated into single line here. The foil is unrolled by the NIP roller. Any vibrations or imbalance of the track are dampened by mechanical dancer with electronic dancer control. The preheated foil is shaped by forming stamp that is controlled by electronic cam. Once the cups have cooled down, they are precisely filled using dedicated metering profiles. Synchronised with the production cycle, the unwinder unrolls precisely one product length of the printed foil, while the register control monitors the position of the printed sealing foil. The horizontal sealing process is controlled by event-based motion profiles. The primary packaged and punched products are then fed individually by the subsequent conveyor belt.. Your other benefits: Ready-to-use technology modules that simplify and speed up the development of sealing technologies for increasing barrier properties tray and blister packaging Improved barrier properties allow longer shelf life at the POS Energy exchange the multi-axis DC-bus system VFFS (vertical forming, filling and … VFFS (vertical forming, filling and sealing): convenience and productivity one. Productivity is simply indispensable here. The products tumble out of the metering chambers into the flat-sealed tubular bags. The foil for this comes from roll that is cut three different colour... Pick-and-place with delta robot: for … Pick-and-place with delta robot: for creating order. Keep everything systematically order - and you see the benefits. Do you suffer due to individual products being supplied chaotically from upstream manufacturing operations? The pick-and-place... SmartTrack: for intelligent product … SmartTrack: for intelligent product grouping. The filled trays are delivered at different intervals. This calls for intelligent solution that structures the process quickly, efficiently and smoothly. HFFS (horizontal forming, filling and … HFFS (horizontal forming, filling and sealing): for clean and precise packaging. The timing is stipulated precisely here. When the trays enter the HFFS machine, they are prepared for the sealing process with the help of pocket conveyor. SideLoader with MagicTrack: bagged … SideLoader with MagicTrack: bagged from the side. To be able to insert the already individually packaged products into multiple packaging container, they are grouped with the help of second two-pass conveyor – so-called MagicTrack. Case erector: keeping everything in … Case erector: keeping everything rank and file. Boxes are folded and glued by the case erector here, ready for side-loading and top-loading. TopLoader with cartesian coordinate … TopLoader with cartesian coordinate robot: looking down from above. Further along the packaging line, the multiple packaging containers that were previously grouped together synchronously with the help of SmartTrack are now delivered to the TopLoader via belt... SmartTrack: for intelligent product … SmartTrack: for intelligent product grouping. The filled trays are delivered at different intervals. This calls for intelligent solution that structures the process quickly, efficiently and smoothly. HFFS (horizontal forming, filling and … HFFS (horizontal forming, filling and sealing): for clean and precise packaging. The timing is stipulated precisely here. When the trays enter the HFFS machine, they are prepared for the sealing process with the help of pocket conveyor. SideLoader with MagicTrack: bagged … SideLoader with MagicTrack: bagged from the side. To be able to insert the already individually packaged products into multiple packaging container, they are grouped with the help of second two-pass conveyor – so-called MagicTrack. Case erector: keeping everything in … Case erector: keeping everything rank and file. Boxes are folded and glued by the case erector here, ready for side-loading and top-loading. TopLoader with cartesian coordinate … TopLoader with cartesian coordinate robot: looking down from above. Further along the packaging line, the multiple packaging containers that were previously grouped together synchronously with the help of SmartTrack are now delivered to the TopLoader via belt... TFFS (thermoform, fill and seal): … TFFS (thermoform, fill and seal): everything single line. From cup production, through filling, all the way up to sealing: everything is integrated into single line here. In order to be able to insert the already individually packaged products into multiple packaging container, they are grouped with the help of second two-pass conveyor – so-called MagicTrack. Transport pockets are formed on parallel conveyor belts or chains. As soon as these pockets have been filled with products, they are taken to the unloading position groups. There, the grouped products are pushed into the multiple packaging container from the side. The transport pockets then return to their loading position order to be loaded again. The pick-and-place delta robot accepts this challenge. So how does it work? A camera system analyses the shape, colour and position of the products on the belt conveyor. On the basis of this information, the Lenze Controller-based Automation calculates the motion profiles of the delta robot order to sort the randomly arriving products and place them empty trays on second belt conveyor. Here, the timing is stipulated exactly. When the trays enter the HFFS machine, they are prepared for the sealing process with the help of pocket conveyor. For sealing purposes, the pocket conveyor pushes the trays into the film tube, whereby the intervals are variable. Sensors then check the position of the product the tube. The sealing process stops immediately if product has been positioned incorrectly or is missing. Synchronised with the production cycle, the film take-off unit draws off exactly one product length of the pre-printed film. The registration mark control unit controls the position of the printed packaging film, whereby the vertical and horizontal sealing processes are event-controlled by means of motion profiles. The primary-packaged products are then separated with the subsequent belt conveyor. Things are good when everything runs smoothly. Products are delivered from the production facility at irregular intervals by means of belt conveyors – and Lenze's Motion Centric Automation your packaging line ensures that all processes remain simple and free of any problems. A pick-and-place delta robot sorts the products into product trays on parallel belt conveyor. Three SmartTrack belt conveyors then position and synchronise the product trays for secondary packaging the HFFS (horizontal forming, filling and sealing) machine. A MagicTrack (two-pass conveyor) groups the sealed products ready for secondary packaging by SideLoader. The products are then packaged groups and the TopLoader loads them into boxes on parallel conveyor belt. In the final step, the palletizer then stacks the boxes on pallets ready for further handling (see Intralogistics ). The next stage is packaging: here, the bottles previously arranged groups of three or four arrive at the film wrapper lined up directly behind one another. The compartment conveyor chain ensures longitudinal grouping for packaging 6-packs. The individual groups can now be wrapped shrink film. The film is unwound and trimmed off by servo-controlled cutter. The front edge of the film is then guided underneath the bottle group. A roller picks up the end by rolling over the pack and wrapping the film around it. The bottles are now ready for the shrink tunnel. The Cartesian coordinate robot picks up three or four bottles and lays them sideways onto second conveyor belt. But how does the grouping work? Beverage - Lenze Hrvatskoj. As easy as that. Hrvatski Hrvatski English Select Country Hrvatska (Croatia) Österreich (Austria) Argentina België (Belgium) Canada България (Bulgaria) Brasil (Brazil) 中国 (China) Česká republika (Czech Republic) Chile Danmark (Denmark) France Suomi (Finland) Deutschland (Germany) Magyarország (Hungary) India Italia (Italy) 한국 (Korea) Latvijā (Latvia) Lietuvoje (Lithuania) México (Mexico) Nederland (Netherlands) Norge (Norway) Polska (Poland) Россия (Russia) Philippines Singapore Slovensko (Slovakia) Slovenija (Slovenia) South Africa España (Spain) Schweiz (Switzerland) Sverige (Sweden) 台灣 (Taiwan) Türkiye (Turkey) United Kingdom United States Tisak Press releases Awards Media gallery Termini Trade fair and events calendar Training Training offers Online Training Contact Karijera Current vacancies Contact Preuzimanje Sales literature Technical documentation Software Downloads Application Knowledge Base CAD data EPLAN P8 macros Certificates and declarations Lenze apps E-katalog Find drive solutions Drive dimensioning Find and configure products Product changeover to g500 geared motors Kontakt Lenze Hrvatskoj Lenze worldwide Contact form Go Home Ekspertize sektoru industrije Consumer goods industry Beverage Motion Centric Automation for your drinks line: successful from start to finish. It's great when everything goes without hitch, even at high speeds: bottles are formed, filled, capped and labelled. Motion Centric Automation from Lenze is the easy way to secure smooth procedures your drinks line. PET preforms are loaded and preheated before being guided into the blow moulding carousel. The finished, cooled bottles are then loaded onto the filler carousel and filled. A FlexCam cam profile reduces the formation of foam here. The filled bottles are then sent to the capper, which presses the preheated caps over the bottle thread and closes them with torque-controlled rotation. The preprinted labels are then attached to the bottles precisely the right position through single rotation using register control. Once this has been completed, pick-and-place gantry robot groups the finished PET bottles, which are subsequently synchronised into 6/8-packs ready for the following packaging process. Shrink film is applied to the packs, which shrinks to form tight seal under the influence of heat the shrink tunnel and thereby holds the bottles together. At the end of the line, palletising robot loads the finished 6-packs onto pallets. They are then dispatched to the logistics centre or directly to the point of sale. PET blow moulding: small becomes … PET Blow Molding Applying even heat and air to create the perfect form: the preforms are separated by the automatic preform loader and transported upwards. Gravity then allows them to slide into the infeed wheel, from... Fillers: keeping everything flowing … Fillers Filling quickly, precisely and without interruptions: the empty PET bottles are conveyed to the filler carousel by the transport chain. Cappers: for the perfect fit. Cappers When closing bottles at high speed, productivity is key: the transport chain moves the filled bottles to the capper. Labellers: making sure the bottles … Labellers Precision is critical during wrap-around labelling: rotary worm screw loads the bottles into the carousel, where they rotate. Pick and Place: because everything … Pick and Place Benefit from systematic arrangement: the finished bottles arrive single row, arranged one behind the other. Film wrappers: packaging bottles. Film wrappers The next stage is packaging: here, the bottles previously arranged groups of three or four arrive at the film wrapper lined up directly behind one another. Shrink tunnels: for the perfect fit. Shrink tunnels Everything needs to fit correctly: the bottles previously wrapped shrink film are transported into the shrink tunnel. Palletisers: successful conclusion. Palletizers This is the last station and successfully completes the drinks line. A monorail overhead conveyor with intelligent control is ideal for materials handling system that can autonomously transport items to prescribed destinations. Consisting of rails that are fitted to the ceiling or mounted on supports, the conveyor transports goods such as body parts, powertrain components, seats or chassis assemblies above the floor to wherever they are required. Inverters directly attached to the overhead conveyor via mount are predestined for this purpose. They must therefore be vibration-resistant and possess degree of protection IP65. The Inverter Drives 8400 protec EMS combined with the compact and adapted GKK overhead conveyor gearbox is the perfect choice here. The enclosed-ventilated motors the MDFQA range are designed for continuous operation with high torque. With their generous dimensioning and bearings and their special winding structure, they guarantee long service life and optimum operational performance all drive situations. The motors offer rated torque values of up to 434 Nm and peak torque values of up to 1,400 Nm power range between 22.6 kW and 95 kW. They are compact, offer IP23 protection and have been developed specifically for operation with Lenze frequency and servo inverters. A broad spectrum of versions covers wide range of applications. The wide field weakening range with high levels of torque reserve allows continuous operation all the way up to high speeds. Hrvatski Hrvatski English Select Country Hrvatska (Croatia) Österreich (Austria) Argentina België (Belgium) Canada България (Bulgaria) Brasil (Brazil) 中国 (China) Česká republika (Czech Republic) Chile Danmark (Denmark) France Suomi (Finland) Deutschland (Germany) Magyarország (Hungary) India Italia (Italy) 한국 (Korea) Latvijā (Latvia) Lietuvoje (Lithuania) México (Mexico) Nederland (Netherlands) Norge (Norway) Polska (Poland) Россия (Russia) Philippines Singapore Slovensko (Slovakia) Slovenija (Slovenia) South Africa España (Spain) Schweiz (Switzerland) Sverige (Sweden) 台灣 (Taiwan) Türkiye (Turkey) United Kingdom United States Tisak Press releases Awards Media gallery Termini Trade fair and events calendar Training Training offers Online Training Contact Karijera Current vacancies Contact Preuzimanje Sales literature Technical documentation Software Downloads Application Knowledge Base CAD data EPLAN P8 macros Certificates and declarations Lenze apps E-katalog Find drive solutions Drive dimensioning Find and configure products Product changeover to g500 geared motors Kontakt Lenze Hrvatskoj Lenze worldwide Contact form Go Home Produkti Previous products Motors MGFRK shunt motor MGFRK shunt motor DC motors the power range: 0.33 to 27 kW The use of DC motors with standard IP54 enclosures has been proven harsh industrial environments for decades. They can be installed flexibly various designs and mounting positions. It is easy to combine them with gearboxes, brakes and feedback systems. The axial forced-ventilation offers large adjustment range with full torque. The motors are fitted with compensation winding. This ensures the correct torque/current proportionality, which can be as much as three times overcurrent with certain motors. This turn allows implementation of concepts such as dynamic positioning or brief high starting duty. In the IEC sizes 90 to 160, power outputs from 0.33 to 27 kW can be achieved depending on the armature voltage and speed. With its round design, the 13.120 range achieves high power density the range from 55 to 600 W. The motors are naturally ventilated and come with IP54 protection. Standard dimensions allow flexible combinations with gearboxes or further built-on accessories from modular pool of equipment. MGFQ shunt motor - Lenze Hrvatskoj. As easy as that. Hrvatski Hrvatski English Select Country Hrvatska (Croatia) Österreich (Austria) Argentina België (Belgium) Canada България (Bulgaria) Brasil (Brazil) 中国 (China) Česká republika (Czech Republic) Chile Danmark (Denmark) France Suomi (Finland) Deutschland (Germany) Magyarország (Hungary) India Italia (Italy) 한국 (Korea) Latvijā (Latvia) Lietuvoje (Lithuania) México (Mexico) Nederland (Netherlands) Norge (Norway) Polska (Poland) Россия (Russia) Philippines Singapore Slovensko (Slovakia) Slovenija (Slovenia) South Africa España (Spain) Schweiz (Switzerland) Sverige (Sweden) 台灣 (Taiwan) Türkiye (Turkey) United Kingdom United States Tisak Press releases Awards Media gallery Termini Trade fair and events calendar Training Training offers Online Training Contact Karijera Current vacancies Contact Preuzimanje Sales literature Technical documentation Software Downloads Application Knowledge Base CAD data EPLAN P8 macros Certificates and declarations Lenze apps E-katalog Find drive solutions Drive dimensioning Find and configure products Product changeover to g500 geared motors Kontakt Lenze Hrvatskoj Lenze worldwide Contact form Go Home Produkti Previous products Motors MGFQ shunt motor MGFQ shunt motor DC motors the power range: 0.33 to 90.8 kW Thanks to their square design, the products this range achieve high power density while maintaining compact overall dimensions. These factors lead to impressively economical drives, which can be easily and precisely regulated using single-quadrant and multi-quadrant DC speed controllers. The safe and quiet natural ventilation and correspondingly designed commutation offer ideal conditions for large power reserves, for example dynamic positioning applications. The motors the MGFQU range operate without compensation. The compensation winding of the MGFQK series leads to correct current/torque proportionality the overcurrent range and prevents instability with field weakening. The DC motors the power range up to and exceeding 90 kW are available as modular system with various degrees of protection. Depending on the application question, they can be combined with matching gearboxes, brakes and feedback systems. The high permissible radial forces and closely stepped speed reduction ratios, coupled with speed variation via variable speed drives on the input side, facilitate matching of the motor to the required machine and process parameters. Whether you opt for handwheel speed variation or electrical speed variation, you find that there are plenty of scalable options to choose from. Thanks to their robust cast iron housing, high permissible torques and closely stepped speed reduction ratios, they can meet even the most stringent of requirements. Depending on the installation space available, variable speed belt drives or planetary variable speed drives can be used to vary the speed within the setting range of 1:6. In Schienentransportsystemen übernehmen Drehzahlregelung kontaktlose Ansteuerung Asynchronmotoren. Die Overhead Control Unit (OCU) vereint dafür notwendige Intelligenz Leistungselektronik robusten Gehäuse. Das System konzipiert, Sie mehrere Motoren über Einheit antreiben können. OCU regelt – üblichen Blockstreckensteuerung Anlagen-SPS – Abstand Fahrzeugen Elektrohängebahn. Parameter können individuell eingegeben werden. Alle für Betrieb relevanten Daten, beispielsweise Zielinformationen, u. a. direkt über Schleifleitungen ausgetauscht. Außerdem induktive Daten- Energieübertragungen möglich. Anpassungen für zukünftige Aufgaben lassen Veränderungen Programmierung offenen Standard IEC 61131-3 jederzeit realisieren. Textdisplays: Textdisplays kostengünstige kompakte Lösung für einfache Anwendungen Automatisierung Maschinen. Mit geringen Einbautiefe passen dort, mal eng wird. Die 2- 4-zeiligen Displays hintergrundbeleuchtet, verfügen serienmäßig über Lenze-Systembus über verschiedene System- Funktionstasten. Grafikdisplays: Das Grafikdisplay vereint Wirtschaftlichkeit, Funktionalität hohen Bedienkomfort modernen Design. Das kompakte Gerät integriertem Systembus Lage, Rezepturen verwalten Daten grafisch darzustellen. Dadurch, Produktionstrends sofort ersichtlich sind, können Maschinenprozesse optimal gefahren werden. Touchscreens: Mit unserem Spektrum Touchscreens bekommen Sie preiswerten Einstieg Grafikwelt. Alle Geräte Systembus ausgestattet ermöglichen Ihnen höchste Flexibilität Gestaltung Bedienoberfläche. Besonders für anspruchsvolle Visualisierungen steht Ihnen 10,4''-TFT-Ausführung geeignetes Gerät Verfügung. Handheld: Das Handheld ermöglicht Ihnen direkte Bedienen Beobachten Ort. Es aufgrund geringen Gewichts Touchscreen-Ausführung komfortabel bedienen. Der unmittelbare Zugriff Bediengerät gleichzeitiger Sicht Maschine bzw. Werkstück unterstützt schnelle Inbetriebnahme. Human Machine Interfaces EPM - Lenze Hrvatskoj. As easy as that. Hrvatski Hrvatski English Select Country Hrvatska (Croatia) Österreich (Austria) Argentina België (Belgium) Canada България (Bulgaria) Brasil (Brazil) 中国 (China) Česká republika (Czech Republic) Chile Danmark (Denmark) France Suomi (Finland) Deutschland (Germany) Magyarország (Hungary) India Italia (Italy) 한국 (Korea) Latvijā (Latvia) Lietuvoje (Lithuania) México (Mexico) Nederland (Netherlands) Norge (Norway) Polska (Poland) Россия (Russia) Philippines Singapore Slovensko (Slovakia) Slovenija (Slovenia) South Africa España (Spain) Schweiz (Switzerland) Sverige (Sweden) 台灣 (Taiwan) Türkiye (Turkey) United Kingdom United States Tisak Press releases Awards Media gallery Termini Trade fair and events calendar Training Training offers Online Training Contact Karijera Current vacancies Contact Preuzimanje Sales literature Technical documentation Software Downloads Application Knowledge Base CAD data EPLAN P8 macros Certificates and declarations Lenze apps E-katalog Find drive solutions Drive dimensioning Find and configure products Product changeover to g500 geared motors Kontakt Lenze Hrvatskoj Lenze worldwide Contact form Go Home Produkti Previous products Controls Human Machine Interfaces EPM Human Machine Interfaces EPM Text displays, graphic displays, touchscreens and hand-held devices used for displaying information and operating The products the EPM range are available as human machine interfaces. Text displays: Text displays are cost-effective and compact solution for easy machine automation applications. Their low mounting depth makes them ideal for installations where space is at premium. The displays, which have between two and four lines, are backlit and feature the Lenze system bus as standard, as well as various system and function keys. Graphics displays: The graphics display combines cost-effectiveness, functionality and high levels of user-friendliness modern design. The compact unit with integrated system bus can manage recipes and display data graphic formats. The fact that production trends are immediately visible allows machine processes to be fully optimised. Touchscreens: Our range of touchscreens grants you affordable access to the world of graphics. All devices come with system bus as standard and offer you the ultimate flexibility when designing user interfaces. The 10.4" TFT model is ideally suited to more complex visualisations. Hand-held unit: The hand-held unit offers you direct local operation and monitoring. Thanks to its light weight and touchscreen design, it is both easy and convenient to use. The ability to access the console directly while visualising machine and workpiece status speeds up commissioning. Drive PLC Drive PLC The inverters are extended to include freely programmable PLC with Drive PLC. With Global Drive Control (GDC), you have access to easily comprehensible and clearly structured tool for operating, parameterising and diagnosing drive tasks. Features: Fast and easy short setup of the drive Easy operation, even for untrained users, thanks to easily comprehensible help functions Convenient diagnostics options via various monitor windows and oscilloscope functions Easy connection to the drive via RS232/485, fibre-optic cable or the system bus Versions: Global Drive Control easy Global Drive Control Drive PLC Developer Studio Drive PLC Developer Studio Drive PLC Developer Studio for the simple programming and commissioning of our PLC products to IEC 61131-3 standards. With 6 editors, debugger, monitoring and other features. Loader Loader The L-force Loader is used to for fast standard set-up. CamDesigner CamDesigner Software for simple generation of curve profiles from graphic curves. CamDesigner - Lenze Hrvatskoj. As easy as that. Hrvatski Hrvatski English Select Country Hrvatska (Croatia) Österreich (Austria) Argentina België (Belgium) Canada България (Bulgaria) Brasil (Brazil) 中国 (China) Česká republika (Czech Republic) Chile Danmark (Denmark) France Suomi (Finland) Deutschland (Germany) Magyarország (Hungary) India Italia (Italy) 한국 (Korea) Latvijā (Latvia) Lietuvoje (Lithuania) México (Mexico) Nederland (Netherlands) Norge (Norway) Polska (Poland) Россия (Russia) Philippines Singapore Slovensko (Slovakia) Slovenija (Slovenia) South Africa España (Spain) Schweiz (Switzerland) Sverige (Sweden) 台灣 (Taiwan) Türkiye (Turkey) United Kingdom United States Tisak Press releases Awards Media gallery Termini Trade fair and events calendar Training Training offers Online Training Contact Karijera Current vacancies Contact Preuzimanje Sales literature Technical documentation Software Downloads Application Knowledge Base CAD data EPLAN P8 macros Certificates and declarations Lenze apps E-katalog Find drive solutions Drive dimensioning Find and configure products Product changeover to g500 geared motors Kontakt Lenze Hrvatskoj Lenze worldwide Contact form Go Home Produkti Previous products Engineering tools CamDesigner CamDesigner Tool for simple generation of curve profiles from graphic curves. You can use the CamDesigner to create and optimise motion profiles and cam groups for electronic cams quickly and intuitively. Whether via data import from CAD or direct entry of the profiles, the CamDesigner supports you right from the very beginning. The motion profiles can be entered very easily using the mouse and the graphic user interface. Features: Fast entry of the relevant parts of the motion profile Easy overview of all motion profiles of the other tools Breaking down complex motion tasks into many simple partial movements The CamManager application is integrated for easy management of all drives and cams Global Drive Control Global Drive Control Global Drive Control is clear and comprehensible tool which can be used for drive task operation, parameterisation and diagnostics. Drive PLC Developer Studio Drive PLC Developer Studio Drive PLC Developer Studio for the simple programming and commissioning of our PLC products to IEC 61131-3 standards. With 6 editors, debugger, monitoring and other features. HMI Designer HMI Designer HMI Designer is software with clearly structured programming environment for drawing up and subsequently programming HMI terminals. Loader Loader The L-force Loader is used to for fast standard set-up. Aktuelle Vollversion Update Global Drive Control V4.14.1 (Vollversion GDCeasy) Beschreibung In modernen Produktionsanlagen übernehmen Antriebssysteme zunehmend eigentlichen Antriebsaufgaben Technologiefunktionen Produktionsprozesses. Mit Global Drive Control (GDC) steht Ihnen verständliches übersichtliches Werkzeug für Bedienung, Parametrierung Diagnose Antriebsaufgabe Verfügung. Systemvoraussetzungen Microsoft® Windows® XP Professional (32 Bit) SP3 / Windows® 7 / Windows® 8 IBM-kompatibler PC (Pentium 333 MHz höher) 128 MB Arbeitsspeicher (RAM) Festplatte mindestens 250 MByte freier Speicherkapazität VGA-Grafikkarte Auflösung min. 1024 768 Bildpunkte Zeigergerät (Maus, Trackball, etc.) Freie serielle bzw. USB - Schnittstelle für Kommunikation Lenze-Antriebsreglern Installation Vollversion GDC 4.x (Update) bzw. Lizenzschlüssel Hinweise Informationen über Funktionserweiterungen Mängelbeseitigungen gegenüber GDC V4.14 entnehmen Sie bitte Differenzbeschreibung . Mit Installationsprogramm können Sie unterschiedliche Installationen durchführen: Vollversion Global Drive Control easy V4.14.1 Update Global Drive Control V4.x V4.14.1 (Installation älteren GDC-Version erforderlich) Vollversion Global Drive Control V4.14.1 (Eingabe Lizenznummer erforderlich) GDC V4.14.1 bietet Funktionsverbesserungen/-erweiterungen, Vorgängerversion GDC V14.4 Gerätedatenupdate GU19 installiert sind. In Fall brauchen Sie Ihr System GDC V4.14.1 updaten. Software-Installation So installieren Sie Global Drive Control V4.14.1 bzw. Global Drive Control easy V4.14.1 Speichern Sie Datei GDC_V41401.zip (110 MB) beliebiges Verzeichnis Ihrem PC Entpacken Sie ZIP-Datei beliebiges Verzeichnis Ihrem PC. Beenden Sie GDC, falls gestartet sollten. Starten Sie Datei setup.exe folgen Sie Installationsanweisungen. Wenn Sie Kommunikationstreiber "Controller Gateway -->..." (GDC Menü Optionen>Kommunikation) benötigen, installieren Sie bitte zusätzlich Global Drive Control die aktuelle Version EASY Starter . Hinweise: Falls Download startet, beachten Sie bitte Hinweise Onlinehilfe. Eventuell Installlation Windows 7/8 Online-Hilfe korrekt dargestellt. Das Problem Update Microsoft-Homepage behoben (für Windows 7 32 Bit: Windows6.1-KB917607-x86.msu, für Windows 7 64 Bit: Windows6.1-KB917607-x64.msu). Produktbezüge: Global Drive Control AKB-ID: 201200380 Letzte Änderung: 21.07.2014 Inhaltstyp: Software Downloads Sämtliche Angaben Seite stehen Vorbehalt jederzeitiger Änderung. It is possible to transfer complete data records directly from the PC to the inverter. However, the various data records cannot be changed using the Loader. Features: Easy data transfer Transferable data records: Complete applications (Engineer LFL files) Compiled PLC programs (DDS files) Parameter set files (GDC files) You can find the L-force EASY Starter free of charge the Application Knowledge Base (AKB). Global Drive Control Global Drive Control Global Drive Control is clear and comprehensible tool which can be used for drive task operation, parameterisation and diagnostics. Drive PLC Developer Studio Drive PLC Developer Studio Drive PLC Developer Studio for the simple programming and commissioning of our PLC products to IEC 61131-3 standards. With 6 editors, debugger, monitoring and other features. HMI Designer HMI Designer HMI Designer is software with clearly structured programming environment for drawing up and subsequently programming HMI terminals. CamDesigner CamDesigner Software for simple generation of curve profiles from graphic curves. Systemvoraussetzungen Microsoft® Windows® 95 / 98 / ME, Windows 2000, Windows NT® 4.0 (ab Service Pack 3), Windows XP, Windows 7 (32 64Bit) IBM-kompatibler PC (Pentium 166 MHz höher) 32 MB Arbeitsspeicher (RAM) 100 MB freie Festplattenkapazität VGA-Grafikkarte Zeigergerät (Maus, Trackball, etc.) Freie serielle Schnittstelle für Kommunikation Bedieneinheit. Hinweise Informationen über Funktionserweiterungen behobene Funktionseinschränkungen gegenüber HMI Designer V1.7 Service Pack 1 entnehmen Sie bitte Differenzbeschreibung . Für Projektierung Kabel notwendig, separat bestellt müssen. Die folgende Liste zeigt, für Bedieneinheit folgende Kabel bzw. Adapterstücke notwendig sind: EPM-H310: Downloadkabel EPZ-H110 + Adapterstück EPZ-H111 EPM-H312: Downloadkabel EPZ-H110 + Adapterstück EPZ-H111 EPM-H315: Downloadkabel EPZ-H110 + Adapterstück EPZ-H111 EPM-H410: Downloadkabel EPZ-H110 EPM-H502: Downloadkabel EPZ-H110 + Adapterstück EPZ-H111 EPM-H505: Downloadkabel EPZ-H110 EPM-H507: Downloadkabel EPZ-H110 + Adapterstück EPZ-H111 EPM-H510: Downloadkabel EPZ-H110 EPM-H515: Downloadkabel EPZ-H110 EPM-H520: Downloadkabel EPZ-H110 EPM-H521: Downloadkabel EPZ-H110 Software-Installation So installieren Sie HMI Designer V1.8: Speichern Sie Datei HmiDesigner_V18.zip (41,7 MB) beliebiges Verzeichnis Ihrem PC. Entpacken Sie ZIP-Datei beliebiges Verzeichnis Ihrem PC. Beenden Sie HMI Designer, falls gestartet sollte. Starten Sie Datei setup.exe folgen Sie Installationsanweisungen. Hinweis: Falls Download startet, beachten Sie bitte Hinweise Onlinehilfe. Starting from precustomised standard applications, individual extensions are easy to implement with the help of freely connectible function blocks – which reduces the load on the control system and facilitates modular machine design. The range can be used universally the power range from 0.37 to 75 kW. To comply with the most diverse of requirements terms of the servo technology, the following four versions are available: 9300 servo inverter 9300 servo position controller 9300 servo cam 9300 servo register controller Using uniform user interface reduces training requirements. Staff only need to learn one system, which can then be used for all applications. The pluggable AIF communication modules allow easy integration into common fieldbus systems. The devices are optionally available with the integrated "safe torque off" function. Servo Drives ECS Servo Drives ECS Inverter for controlled, dynamic motion.
